intro: Crossostephium turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan crossostephium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to Central Asia and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
